1.content:
(Chapter originally by Apollo)

Mackenzie's heart was threatening to bounce right out of her chest and leap halfway around the world. She was no stranger to this sort of thing anymore, but she that didn't make this any easier, and it also didn't help her in this new situation. However, the book in her hands was an excellent way of keeping her mind off her situation and hope her heart would relax on its own once she started breathing normally. She hoped.

One hot, restless night during last month's heat wave, Mackenzie found herself too uncomfortable to sleep. Her sleepwear changed several times that night, starting from a full set of light summer pajamas before making its way into a a light, well worn T-shirt she used almost exclusively for the gym, and even that was soon discarded for her birthday suit. When sleeping naked atop the covers still proved extremely hot, the red head came to the conclusion she'd have to open a window. Even in the face of flashing her 35C breasts to any perverts out on a late night stroll, the six foot tall red head wouldn't dress in even the light shirt, believing she'd still flash her little red landing strip and the pink treasure beneath it. She didn't like this choice either, but decided that openly flashing her boobs would distract from the less visible lips in the junction of her legs. Plus, it was just too hot to dress again, so hot it was likely no one was out anyway, a conclusion she verified when she didn't hear a hush or spy a soul after opening the window.

Even with the window open, the room remained too stuffy for her to redress, though she did climb under the thinnest sheet of her bed. Still uncomfortable, Mackenzie decided to play with the window again, but this time wouldn't adjust it. Instead, she decided to see how long she could keep herself in front of the window before some noise scared her back into bed. She sat in front of that quiet window for what felt like hours, even though the moon in the sky made it clear it was only fifteen minutes. The rush of adrenaline banished her exhaustion, and the game took her mind off the unbearable room temperature. It wasn't until nature called and broke her game did she fall from her high and into bed sleeping. While all that happened that night was a little flashing and an indoor streak in an otherwise empty house, it started Mackenzie's exhibitionism.

In the month that followed, Mackenzie's restless nights were spent meandering around her backyard, walking around her house "checking" all the windows that faced the street at some angle, or even cleaning her walkway and the sidewalk in front of her house. She hadn't been caught yet, and her run of good luck had numbed her to the possibility of getting caught, making it seem as though it was only possible in her mind for the sole purpose of exciting her. This attitude accounted for today's actions and the dropkick she took to the head for performing them.

Feeling more adventurous, Mackenzie decided to bring her game into the light of day for the first time on this Saturday. Carrying only a book, the nubile red head elected to spend the morning lying in the grass reading and blasting away the tan lines left by her bikini. The month of experimenting revealed that some jewelry gave her the illusion of cover, and she hated it. It felt better when she wasn't wearing anything besides a pearly white smile. She added in a coat of insect repellent, but only because she figured that would be better than having a bite or sting somewhere sensitive. The stiffness of her skin didn't break her fantasy, but it did make her a bit uncomfortable.

The sound of motors running was becoming more apparent, an alarm of sorts for Mackenzie, telling her that it's time to go inside and wash. Her skin hadn't shown much improvement, but her tan lines were a bit fainter and there weren't any signs of a burn. Regardless, she picked herself up and walked the five steps to her back door. As a reflex, Mackenzie always locked a door after she closed it unless she consciously sent out the command "Stop!" Her back door was locked, but Mackenzie wasn't too worried about it. One of her emergency keys was kept in one of the small plastic rocks various companies make and sell, and she made sure to move the rock right next to her door before she went out. She'd done that every night she went out to let herself back in, and this morning was no different, except for one thing.

"Oh no. Oh no! No! NO!"

It took her a while to remember, but it finally came back to the red head. On her last night out, Mackenzie returned drowsy enough to out sleep Rip Van Winkle, and instead of replacing the key, she placed it on a table and decided to put it back after she got to sleep. However, Mackenzie had forgotten about this deviation when she awoke, leaving the key on the wrong side of the locked door. Only now did Mackenzie realize she could actually be seen stark naked, and she'd have to if she wanted to get back inside.

Mackenzie had two spare emergency keys, but neither was placed in a very favorable location. One was with Marianne, her very best friend in the world since college. If Mackenzie was ever in trouble, she could always count on Marianne to help. Unfortunately, Marianne lived with her boyfriend. In a crowded apartment building. Located on a busy street. About two miles away. And there's no guarantee they'd be home.

The other key was much closer, 23 steps, or so say Mackenzie's nightly walks. She kept it with her neighbor, Rachel. It seemed like a good idea at the time. The two of them quickly built a solid friendship, they could do things together when they didn't have plans, and talk about real things. Rachel almost turned Marianne and Mackenzie's Dynamic Duo into Three Musketeers, and both Rachel and Marianne seemed receptive to Mackenzie's description of the other. However, this went south when the three of them got together last week. As luck would have it, Marianne and Rachel knew each other very well from high school. Rachel cheated Marianne out of a slot on the cheer squad, and Marianne retaliated by stealing her boyfriend. Evidently the story was of significantly greater girth, but Rachel stormed off afterwards and Marianne chose to put Rachel out of her mind to have a nice lunch with her best friend. While not really Mackenzie's problem, she's been too afraid to approach Rachel since then and has no clue how Rachel feels about her anymore. This could be like poking a hornets nest naked, and the feeling in Mackenzie's stomach didn't subside once she realized she was already half way there.

"Maybe a different approach?" Mackenzie mumbled, musing other possibilities.
1.title: The Big Mistake

choices: Mackenzie tries the park. Better safe than sorry.
Mackenzie takes the direct route. The sooner she's clothed, the better.
Mackenzie chances the college route. Maybe she'll luck out?
Perhaps there's another route?
11.content:
As much as Mackenzie hated to admit it, her best bet was with Marianne. She's the one person guaranteed to help, and while she couldn't be certain Marianne was home, she wouldn't be at work on a Saturday and would hopefully only be gone for a quick errand at most. Now, the only question that remained was what route to take.

Thinking carefully, Mackenzie figured that she had three possible courses. One was safe, but extended the length of her trip substantially, another was quickest but incredibly risky, and the third was a tossup.

If she was willing to add a good mile or two to her trek, Mackenzie could try to make a break for the nearby park. The park was quite large, and the patches of dense trees and other plant life offered ample hiding places and discreet paths. However, there was always the chance that Mackenzie could get turned around, or lost, or accidentally stumble upon people, but that was equally true with the other options.

The most direct route was simple. If Mackenzie stuck to the roads, she could retrace the usual route she takes when she drives to Marianne's place. However, once she was out of suburbia and into the busier part of town where Marianne's apartment complex was located, there would be little to no hiding places. If she was quick, clever, and lucky, she just might be able to make her way to the apartment unseen... however, luck clearly wasn't on her side this morning, so this thought did little to settle her rapid heartbeat.

Finally, there was the route that could either be perfect, or total disaster. Mackenzie lived in a college town, and the campus happened to be between her home and Marianne's apartment. Mackenzie could sneak through the suburbs until she reached the campus, then cut through the open area and cut down the distance of her trip quite nicely, and avoid the city streets. Unfortunately, she knew the campus layout and realized that there would be essentially zero cover. For all intents and purposes, she'd be streaking the college. Since it was Saturday, the campus could be largely dead since nobody would have classes to attend. However, the nice weather might mean the campus is flooded with students enjoying the day...

Mackenzie thought carefully about her options, shivering slightly in the occasional breeze that served only to remind her how bare she truly was. Finally, she took a deep breath and began walking, her path decided.
11.title: Make the run to Marianne. It's certain to w...

choices: Mackenzie gets lost.
Mackenzie hears a group of people coming her way!
It begins to storm.
111.content:
While effectively doubling the distance she'd have to cover wasn't an appealing idea, Mackenzie couldn't deny that the park was the safest route. She could at least try to hide if she came across any people, and the trees would make for good cover from the sun or rain if the weather took a turn for the worse. Of course, being as nice of a day as it was, there was the very real possibility that there would be plenty of people at the park...

"It's not like I have a whole lot of options." Mackenzie said to herself. "I've got to get my spare key from Marianne if I want to get out of this mess."

Reluctantly, Mackenzie made her way to the gate that separated her back yard from the alley. Turning the handle and slowly cracking the gate open, she carefully peeked her head out, looking all around for any signs of life. Seeing nobody, Mackenzie slowly stepped out of the safety of her back yard and into the alley, her bare feet protesting against the transition from soft grass to rough gravel. As the gate to her back yard closed behind her, the click of the lock made it clear that there was no turning back from here. The only way back to her property now would be from the street, and the only way she was going there was with clothes and her spare key.

Thankfully for Mackenzie, it seemed that none of her neighbors had any business that brought them into the alley, and she was able to make her way towards the park with little trouble. Of course, that didn't stop the naked redhead from jumping at every small rustle of leaves and holding her breath at the sound of a passing car. Still, her luck managed to hold out, and Mackenzie was soon at the edge of the alleyway. From here, the nervous young woman could see the edge of the park, just at the end of the road, about half a block away. Looking around again, Mackenzie was relieved to see that none of the houses showed signs of activity on their front porches. If anybody was home, they must have been indoors. Hoping that none of them were glancing outside, Mackenzie took a deep breath and ran like her life depended on it.

While Mackenzie had never been a star athlete, she had always kept in shape through dancing and light exercise, but it was sheer adrenaline that helped her achieve her speed at the moment. Mackenzie had never run so fast in her life, and if the idea of streaking down the street of her neighborhood wasn't absolutely terrifying, she'd have been impressed with herself. Of course, terrified as she was, Mackenzie had no time to take pride in her feat of athletic prowess, and simply bolted down the street for the cover of the trees.

Incredibly, Mackenzie's gamble paid off! The unpleasant burn of sun-baked pavement on her feet gave way to cool grass once more, and the bright sunlight that showcased her naked body brilliantly was replaced with cooling shade that gave her (admittedly minimal) concealment. Once she was a few meters past the treeline, Mackenzie took a moment to bend over, leaning against a tree as she caught her breath. As scary as it had been, she had made it through undetected. Now there was just the matter of... making the now four mile journey to Marianne's apartment complex...

"This... this is the worst day of my life." Mackenzie muttered to herself as she panted. "But hey... at least it can't get much worse."

Mackenzie should have known better than to jinx herself like that. In a situation like hers, there were plenty of ways things could get worse, and indeed, for the unfortunate redhead. The next problem presented itself as-
111.title: Mackenzie tries the park. Better safe than sorry.

11113.content:
She come upon another dilemma from when she first started this cursed trek of hers. In front of her was two areas, a baseball field, and a children's playground. Why couldn't her luck finally give her a break?! Was she just doomed to be the naked girl in public forever by some whim of a creature she didn't know? Shaking the gloom from her thoughts, Mackenzie looked over both areas carefully.

On the one hand, the ball field was completely empty and seemed devoid of any life. Yet she knew that just like the park she had tried earlier, that it could swiftly change to her disfavor. On the other hand, she saw plenty of parents, mostly mothers, and their children cavorting through the playground. They were all laughing and enjoying themselves.

Not one to risk fate in case it screwed her over again, Mackenzie looked back and forth, judging her options, then decided to skirt the edges of both. Hopefully this way, she could both avoid being seen by the people on the grounds, and quickly navigate the deserted area to find her way back towards home. It would be a long stretch though but she had no choice. Sighing, she made her way down, looking fearfully this way and that, but so far so good.

Of course, as her luck would have it, this changed in the worst possible way.

From out of nowhere, a ball came sailing over and gently whacked her on the head, before dropping to the ground. It was a foam ball, and Mackenzie paled at seeing it, remembering that kids were playing with it at the playground. Before she could find a place to hide, footsteps ran up behind her and a little girl bent down to retrieve the ball. When she made to run back, she spotted the naked red-head.

"Hey! Why are you nakey?!" she screeched, obviously used to her outside voice

"Shh! Please!" Mackenzie whispered. "I just ran into a bit of bad luck and need some help is all." if there was one thing Mackenzie didn't want, it was attention.

The girl ignored her distress, more curious than before.

"Bad luck? Help? I can help!" she cried, then ran off before Mackenzie could refute her.

Looking to where she ran Mackenzie paled further as she could clearly see the girl talking to a few other kids and adults, then pointing right at her. She needed to get out of here! But that wasn't possible, as the people, first with looks of shock at seeing a naked girl in public, then headed toward her with clear intent. Trapped like a dear, Mackenzie could only stand there as she was quickly surrounded.

"What are you doing?"

"Why are you naked young lady?"

"She's nakey! She's nakey!"

"Is this a prank?"

These were only a few of the questions she heard as she tried to explain herself, but they decided to talk over her.

Before long...

1112.content:
As Mackenzie leaned up against the tree, catching her breath, she her attention was drawn to some noise slowly growing louder. As she listened, Mackenzie realized with growing fear that the noise was conversation! Mackenzie could make out at least three voices, but there could easily have been more than three people, and they were heading her way! If Mackenzie didn't do something quickly, there's no question that she'd be seen.

As her heart began to race once more, fear rising to the front of her emotions, Mackenzie frantically looked around for a place to hide. This was the reason Mackenzie had elected to take the park route, after all, and she quickly identified a couple potential hiding spots.

Her first option was the very tree she was leaning against. It wouldn't be too difficult to climb up the tree and try to hide in the branches. Of course, if Mackenzie wasn't hidden well enough and somebody decided to look up, then she'd be spotted with little problem. Even worse, if the group heading her way decided to stop here, well, she'd be stuck in that tree until they moved on again. The idea of being huddled up in a tree for an unknown length of time wasn't exactly appealing...

The next option wouldn't exactly hide Mackenzie, but it would at least hide the fact that she was completely naked. A few meters away from her current spot was a stream that flowed through the park. The water wasn't exactly crystal clear, and would obscure her body from view. Of course, there was the fact that taking a dip in the cold, somewhat dirty stream wasn't exactly the most pleasant idea in the world. Also something to consider was the fact that Mackenzie wasn't the strongest swimmer in the world, and if the steam's current was too strong it could end up carrying her far off course.

Mackenzie had to decide, and quickly if the volume of the voices was any indication. Tree or stream? Her modesty depended on it!

A troop of boy scouts.

The nearest option was often the safest in Mackenzie's opinion. As such, it only made sense for the beautiful redhead to start climbing the tree with all her might. The naked beauty had only just started to situate herself among the branches when the voices finally reached the area. Had she been even a few seconds slower to react or decide, she'd have been in full view of the group.

Looking down from her hiding place within the tree, Mackenzie's breath caught in her throat as she caught a glimpse of who she'd been hearing. A chill of fear ran down the redhead's spine as she found herself hiding above-

112.content:
The short, direct path won out for Mackenzie. It was still an early Saturday morning; she was going to going along the roads, but she felt like maybe she could channel her adrenaline to something more positive.

Mackenzie began what she knew might be the longest walk of her life at a brisk pace. She was glad that the exercise was warming her understandably cool, unclothed flesh. She glanced around with haste as she came to the first corner, and went ahead. So far, so good. Maybe I'll make it through this okay.

Her hasty check caused her to miss another morning walk enthusiast. His name was Dennis, an psychology major and baseball player at the college. Dennis was also an ass man, and seeing Mackenzie's bare, curvy booty sway above her long legs pointed to an excellent weekend for him.

Dennis followed her carefully; his arousal momentarily gave way to concern that she was some kind of victim. Seeing the naked redheaded beauty had no visible injuries and was not calling for help, Dennis reasoned it was something else. Maybe she's doing a sorority initiation. Or maybe she's protesting something. Either way, Dennis took out his phone, and happily recorded the ginger's sexy butt for the next block.

Mackenzie started to get in a sixth sense she was being watched. She had been trying to keep her eyes open so far, but realized there was so many different directions the places she was walking to might see her: from windows, in their vehicles, going to the mail. She was considering stopping to grab something like a newspaper to give her a hint of cover when she heard a ringtone. She froze for a moment with dread.

"Damn it" Dennis mouthed as he quickly silenced his phone. Did you really have to call right now, Jose? I don't call you when you're ogling a beautiful, naked lady.

Mackenzie's cheeks were almost as red as her hair. She felt fight-or-flight kicking with full force. Still, she tried to control herself. Besides confronting whoever was behind her, or literally running naked, she might be able to get help from the person (or persons) behind her. After all, they must have got an eyeful of her bare bottom already...
112.title: Mackenzie takes the direct route.

Mackenzie gets spotted by a frat.
Mackenzie makes it to the campus, which is nothing like she remembers.
113.content:
Mackenzie hadn't been to the campus since she was a student, and while that wasn't terribly long ago, it was still enough time for things to change. Still, the campus couldn't be too different from how she remembered it, right? Just a few buildings for classes, the theater hall, dorm buildings, the wide open space of the quad, and Greek Row. Greek Row was off to the side in comparison to where Mackenzie needed to go, the class buildings should be empty on a weekend, and the only real question was how populated the quad was.

At least, that was what Mackenzie had reasoned when she set out on her journey. Sprinting across the streets, staying low to the ground as she crept through lawns and backyards, the freshly cut grass and soft flower petals of people's gardens lightly tickling at her flawless skin. If there was one thing Mackenzie could be grateful for, it was that her neighborhood wasn't terribly active in the mornings. At last, Mackenzie was at the last block before she reached the campus. Carefully stepping into the alleyway to cut through the block, Mackenzie saw something that made her blood run cold: the Greek alphabet.

More specifically, Mackenzie saw Greek lettering on every house on this last street. She was on Greek Row! How did she get here?! Greek Row was supposed to be on another end of the campus entirely! At least, it had been when she was a student... Apparently things had changed. What Mackenzie didn't know was that the old Greek Row had been torn down to expand the campus, adding several new administrative buildings. The houses along the street she was currently on were bought up by the college and re-purposed as the new Greek Row.

Suddenly, Mackenzie found herself in a much more intense situation. Frats and Sororities weren't exactly the most kind and understanding groups, especially some of the ones at Mackenzie's old college. A few were notorious as "Party Houses", their members more preoccupied with having a good time than earning a good education. Mackenzie had never joined a sorority, though a few had tried to recruit her. Right now, the naked redhead wished she had joined up with one, if only so she could try asking for help. As it was, she just needed to make sure none of the sororities spotted her, or even worse, one of the frats...

Her heartbeat could be confused for a fully automatic machine gun at this point, but Mackenzie had to press onward. She'd already committed to her path, and turning around to try a new route would only waste time at this point. Taking a deep breath, Mackenzie did her best to cover her privates with her hands and arms, and ran for her life (as best as she could with one arm across her chest and a hand between her legs, at least)...

With her feet slapping on the pavement of the sidewalk, Mackenzie could see the edge of the main campus at the end of the street. Just a little further and she'd be on to the next leg of her arduous journey...

12.content:
While going to Rachel might prove a terrible idea, Mackenzie would never be able to forgive herself if she ended up streaking two miles only to find out later that it was unnecessary. Forcing herself to control her breathing, Mackenzie carefully crept along the side of her house. Keeping low to the ground in a vain attempt at stealth, she timidly peered up and down the street, keeping a lookout for cars or pedestrians.

Finding the street thankfully empty and not wanting to waste time lest that change, Mackenzie darted out from her hiding spot, the sound of her feet slapping on the pavement seeming to her louder than a thunderstorm. After a short but frantic sprint, Mackenzie found herself on the front porch of Rachel's house and began to feel a renewed sense of dread.

Rachel wasn't the type to merely get angry. She was a force of vengeance when she felt slighted, and made it clear she reveled in the misfortune of those she disliked. If she still held bitter feelings about her association with Marianne, appealing to her for help could put Mackenzie in a very bad spot. But, if Rachel had calmed down, she might be willing to help... though she might need convincing nonetheless...

Steeling her nerves, and holding her book over her exposed rear end lest someone on the street see her, Mackenzie tentatively knocked on Rachel's door. The wait felt agonizingly long, and Mackenzie began to worry that Rachel might not even be home, making her risk detection all for nothing.
12.title: Try Rachel. Real friendship doesn't crumble...

121.content:
The click of the lock sent equal parts relief and anxiety through Mackenzie's body. Deciding she'd rather leave her shapely ass exposed to the street than flash Rachel, Mackenzie quickly re-positioned her arms, holding her book in front of her crotch and crossing an arm awkwardly across her chest.

Rachel's greeting died on her lips as she saw who was had knocked on her door, and how said person was (un)dressed. Before she could regroup and voice her shock, Mackenzie began speaking.

"Hey Rachel, it's a really long story, but the thing is I'm kinda locked out of my house and really need to get back inside so I can get dressed. Could you give me that spare key I gave you so I can get back inside? I'd really owe you one!" Mackenzie blurted out at light speed, her heart racing faster with every word. Anxiously, she looked Rachel in the eyes, putting on her best pleading look in hopes that it would sway her once-friend's sympathies.

Rachel simply stared at Mackenzie for a long moment, apparently processing what she had said. Mackenzie involuntarily shivered as she felt Rachel's eyes sweep over her bare body, trying to ignore it and hoping that Rachel would just hurry up and grab that key she so desperately needed.

Finally, Rachel responded. Rather than words, she let her actions do the talking.

122.content:
As soon as the door opened and Rachel popped her head out to see who it was, her expression changed from annoyed to who could be bothering her at this time of night, to surprise at the person in front of her and their state of (un)dress, then once again to a sort of smug satisfaction and victory at the prospect in front of her.

"Hey Rachel, I know it's kinda late and it's not really a great time to be here but I could really use a hand since I've been locked out without any clothes and I could really use your help to get back inside or get some clothing or anything please help me!" Rachel strained her concentration to keep up with the run-on sentence, but she basically understood the jist of it.

Rachel's first reaction was to simply slam the door in Mackenzie's face, maybe even take the book she was holding as cover just to spite her, but after a moment of consideration, she deemed it would be much better and more satisfying to help Mackenzie and reap the benefits of leveraging this over her for more to come.

"Okay, I think I can help you out here," Rachel relished the sight of Mackenzie's eye widening in joy, and couldn't wait to wreck that all over again "provided you do something for me."

"W-what do you want?" Mackenize hesitated, she knew that Rachel had something in mind as payback, but she really had no choice in the matter now, she had to comply.

"Easy, I want to borrow a book from you," Rachel shrugged and pointed at the book Mackenzie was using for cover "namely that one."

"Is... Is that it?" Mackenzie started to breath again, although still on guard, this couldn't be the only thing Rachel wanted, could it?

"Yup." Rachel replied succintly.

The reply was followed by a slightly elongated moment of silence, where Mackenzie didn't know how to react.

"Well? Give it here already!" Rachel stuck her hand out and demanded.

"What, right now?" Mackenzie shrank away, not knowing what to think of Rachel's demand "But I'll be standing out here completely naked!"

"That's the point." Rachel insisted, which put Mackenzie in another awkward spot.

Mackenzie wrestled with herself before finally giving in and handing the book over to Rachel, her previous cover was immediately replaced by her hands, which frankly did not do as good a job as the book did, she was never more embarrassed and humiliated in her entire life, and this was simply her standing stark naked in front of her own (former) friend, it was a completely different sensation from walking around in the comfort of her own house.

info.description:
This story has been relocated from a now-defunct interactive story, as one story between several possible characters seemed to create issues.

This is the story of Mackenzie, a beautiful redhead who foolishly finds herself locked out of her own house stark naked, and all potential ways back in less than ideal. This is a very long day Mackenzie is sure to never forget.

General rules: While Mackenzie can find something to cover herself up with, it shouldn't last more than a chapter or two before it is sacrificed or lost. Mackenzie absolutely does NOT want to be discovered, but her luck in this regard falls to you, the contributor.

*Note: Mackenzie is normally age 25, but due to this information not being clearly present, one story path has her as an 18 year old high school senior. Since this age specification wasn't clear at the time of the path being made (and due to quality of the chapters added) they are being left in. However, all other story paths should treat Mackenzie as her 25 year old self.*

Restrictions: The usual restrictions apply- NO rape, gore, vore, scat, shrinking/growing, or diaper related content. Other forms of sex are acceptable on a case-by-case basis.

I reserve the right to delete any chapters I feel are inappropriate.
